results.title: Tchou-tchou (K)
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Pierre Moretti and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A children’s fantasy where building blocks and musical effects do everything. Blocks represent the make-believe city and the two children who play in it. Blocks act out the story when an angry dragon appears on the scene and the music underscores the action. The puppet theatre is so colourfully presented that everyone is absorbed and entertained. A film without words. (Awards: five including London; Annecy)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Co Hoedeman, Pierre Moretti and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tchookovsky
results.brief_description: A man begins a piano recital but the music that emerges sounds awful. It seems a turkey that has taken up residence under the lid of the grand is the cause of his problems.

results.title: Tchaikovsky: Public triumph... personal despair
results.creator_credit: Graham Holloway, Bob Carruthers, Beckmann and Cromwell Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music maestro”.
Adoring audiences, international acclaim and an independent fortune should have made Tchaikovsky a happy man. Unfortunatley they seemed only to add to the secret anguish of a tortured soul hiding dark secrets from the stifling high society of 19th Century Russia. Innovative and informative, this program explores the character of the man and builds a picture of his life and times. Using feature films inserts, stunning period images and a masterful narrative by conductor/composer David Palmer, combined with superb performances by internationally renowned artists, this is an unforgettable record of the life of one of the world’s great composers. Featuring performances of such classics as: 1812 Overture, excerpts from Swan Lake, The Nutcracker Suite, the Slavonic March and more.

results.title: TB trailer
results.brief_description: Points out that TB (tuberculosis) can be eradicated from Australia, if sufferers are found and cured. Urges that everyone, including older people, should have an annual chest X-ray.

results.title: Taxithi
results.creator_credit: Christina Heristanidis, Peter Tammer and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Taxithi, which means “journey” in Greek, examines an integral but often overlooked and under-represented part of Australian contemporary society: migrant culture. Melbourne filmmaker Christina Heristanidis turns the camera on her immediate surroundings, specifically, her Greek parents, their culture and history in order to understand and appreciate their Greek-Australianess. As well as capturing her parents relaxing at home or attending their social clubs, Christina also accompanies them on a road trip they take to the country with their community of friends. The manner in which they deal with encounters and express themselves through their culture (singing, dancing, communal happiness) as a group evokes the film’s central theme: that migrants bring their culture with them, that culture continues through people rather than solely through place and that this shared culture enables community, solace and optimism. In “Taxithi”, the camera becomes an extension of the filmmaker that often turns onto the filmmaker herself and her own relations with her parents. Never short of humour, warmth and goodwill, “Taxithi” is a special documentary that reveals the richness and history that lies below the surface of everyday Australian suburbia.

results.title: Taxi!
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Arthur Hammond and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In any large city one of the most visible and, at the same time, anonymous characters is the taxi driver. Taxi! takes an absorbing, entertaining and sometimes comical look at a world few of us are familiar with. The filmmaker, a former cabbie, has produced a unique documentary study of the drivers, fleet operators and dispatchers who are expected to deliver passengers, parcels, and even babies. Photographed by day and night, the film explores the realities of the taxi business, the economics, and life as witnessed from behind the steering wheel.

results.title: Taxi to Rumdoodle
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the hardy taxi to Rumdoodle, which takes passengers over the snow and ice to Mawson base from the airstrip at Rumdoodle in Antarctica. Shows how the car stands up to the cold weather, and rough conditions, saving the snow-cat and tractors for other work and maintaining speeds of 40-50 m.p.h. on sea ice. Shows the penguins, seals and huskies, typical scenery and the men of the A.N.A.R.E. at work at the base and on inland expeditions.
